_comment: Created by ianb on 14/10/2013 11:43:36 using v0.9
title: How has the proportion in paid employment changed by hours worked?
analysis_commentary: Each year, the highest proportion (around a third) of employed adults with a learning disability work four to 16 hours a week. The smallest proportion (roughly 5%) consistently work regularly, but less than weekly. The proportion of adults working more than 30 hours a week has declined from 14.8% in 2009/10 to 12% in 2011/12 (data for this distribution are not yet available for 2012/13).
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, Adult Social Care - Combined Activity Return (ASC-CAR)
